page.title: 08JEMIMA NICHOLAS
page.content: The Gravestone of local heroine Jemima Nicholas is at St Mary's Church, Fishguard. She died at her home in Main Street in July 1832. She marched to meet the French Invaders who landed on our shores in February 1797. At the date of the Invasion she was 47 years old. She told all the women of Fishguard about the Invasion, and she thought up a plan. It was if the ladies would put on red shawls and black hats they would look like red coats. When the French saw them marching they thought they were redcoats. The French surrendered and signed a peace treaty in the Royal Oak in Fishguard. The table they signed the peace treaty on is still in the Royal Oak.
